tuv.seg: You may be called to give evidence as a witness in a criminal case or a civil case
D'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofaí ort le fianaise a thabhairt mar fhinné i gcás coiriúil nó i gcás sibhialta
You may be called as an "eye-witness" if you personally witnessed something happen that is relevant to the case
D'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofaí ort mar "fhinné súl" má chonaic tusa go pearsanta rud ag tarlú a bhaineann leis an gcás
You may be called by either side in the case, whether it is a criminal case or a civil case
Is féidir le ceachtar den dá thaobh sa chás glaoch ort, is cuma cé acu cás coiriúil nó sibhialta atá i gceist
When you take the stand, a Bible will be handed to you and you will repeat the oath or affirmation that you will "tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth"
Nuair a théann tú ar an seastán, tabharfar Bíobla duit agus athdheirfidh tú an mionn nó dearbhú go n-inseoidh tú an fhirínne, an fhírinne ghlan gan tada ach an fhírinne
You will then be asked a series of questions to allow you to describe what you witnessed
Cuirfear ceisteanna ansin ort le deis a thabhairt duit insint céard a chonaic tú
Your evidence as an "eye-witness" will be confined to the facts, i.e. what you actually saw, rather than any inferences or assumptions you have made from what you saw
Baineann an fhianaise a thugann tú mar "fhinné súl" leis na fíricí amháin, is é sin an méid a chonaic tú go díreach, seachas aon chonclúidí nó barúlacha atá agat maidir leis an rud a chonaic tú
You will then be cross-examined by the other side
Déanfaidh an taobh eile ansin tú a chroscheistiú
You may be called as an "expert witness" by either side in a case about a matter that is outside the ordinary knowledge of the judge or jury
D'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofadh ceachtar den dá thaobh i gcás ort mar "fhinné saineolaí" le fianaise a thabhairt a bhaineann le ábhar atá taobh amuigh den ghnáth eolas a bheadh ag breitheamh nó giúiré
For example, you may be called as a handwriting expert or as a doctor to give an opinion on something that is relevant to the case
Mar shampla, d'fhéadfaí glaoch ort mar shaineolaí lámhscríbhneoireachta nó mar dhochtúir le tuairim a thabhairt ar cheist a bhaineann leis an gcás
Your opinion is accepted as evidence because you are an expert on the subject and because the court does not have the knowledge or expertise itself to form a reliable opinion on the facts
Glactar le do thuairim mar fhianaise ós rud é gur saineolaí ar an ábhar thú agus mar gheall nach bhfuil an t-eolas ná an saineolas ag an gcúirt féin le tuairim údarásach a thabhairt ar na fíricí
As an expert witness, you must also take the oath or affirmation
Mar fhinné saineolaí ní mór duit mionn nó dearbhú a dhéanamh
You will then be asked to explain why you are an expert in the particular area, i.e. to outline your qualifications or work experience
Iarrfar ort ansin a mhíniú cén fáth gur féidir saineolaí a thabhairt ort maidir leis an gceist áirid, is é sin, cur síos a dhéanamh ar do cháilíochtaí nó taithí oibre
You will then be asked a series of questions to allow you to give your opinion about certain facts
Cuirfear ceisteanna ansin ort le deis a thabhairt duit do thuairim maidir le fíricí faoi leith a thabhairt
Finally, you will be cross-examined by the other side
Ar deireadh, déanfaidh an taobh eile tú a chroscheistiú
There are different situations where you may be called as a "character witness":
Tá amanna éagsúla inár féidir glaoch ar dhuine mar "fhinné carachtair":
• You may be called as a character witness to give evidence of the good character of the accused in a criminal case
• D'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofaí ort mar fhinné carachtair le fianaise a thabhairt maidir le dea-cháil an chúisí i gcás coiriúil
You will take the oath or affirmation and you will then be asked a series of questions to allow you to describe the accused
Déanfaidh tú mionn nó dearbhú agus ansin cuirfear ceisteanna ort a thabharfaidh deis duit cur síos a dhéanamh ar an gcúisí
The purpose of your evidence is to show that the accused is less likely to have committed the offence because he or she is a person of good character
Tá sé mar aidhm ag d'fhianaise a thaispeáint go bhfuil níos lú seans ann gur dhein an cúisí an choir mar gheall gur duine de dhea-cháil é/í
• You may be called as a character witness to give evidence of the good character of a person who has already been convicted of a criminal offence
• D'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofaí ort mar fhinné carachtair ar son duine atá ciontaithe cheana as coir choiriúil
The purpose of your evidence is to help the judge decide which sentence to impose
Tá sé mar aidhm ag d'fhianaise cúnamh a thabhairt don bhreitheamh cinneadh a dhéanamh cén pionós gur cheart a ghearradh
• You may be called as a character witness to give evidence about the good or bad character of a party in a civil trial if that party's character is an important issue in the case
• D'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofaí ort mar fhinné carachtair le fianaise a thabhairt maidir le dea nó droch cháil duine i dtriail sibhialta más ceist tábhachtach í carachtair an duine sin ó thaobh an cháis

For example, in a defamation case where a newspaper stated that a person was a "rogue", you may be called to give evidence about an incident you witnessed that tends to show that the person in question was of dubious character

Mar shampla, i gcás aithisithe áit ar dúradh i nuachtán gur "rógaire" é/í duine d'fhéadfadh sé go nglaofaí ort le fianaise a thabhairt maidir le eachtra a chonaic tú féin ag tarlú gur dóigh a thaispeánann gur carachtair amhrasach é/í an duine atá i gceist
You will make the oath or affirmation and then you will be asked a series of questions to allow you describe what you know of the party's character
Déanfaidh tú mionn nó dearbhú agus ansin cuirfear ceisteanna ort a thabharfaidh deis duit cur síos a dhéanamh ar a bhfuil ar eolas agat maidir le carachtair an duine
You will then be cross-examined by the other side
Ansin déanfaidh an taobh eile tú a chroscheistiú
For more detailed information you should seek legal advice
Ba chóir duit comhairle dlí a lorg chun faisnéis mionsonraithe a fháil
